newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee gains against spot, forward dollar.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee gains against spot, forward dollar.

text.p: The Indian rupee edged up against the spot and forward dollar in late morning trade on Friday, dealers said.
Spot rupee had gained to 35.815.825 from 35.83/84 opening on subdued dollar demand.
Dealers said the Industrial Development Bank of India was looking to buy dollars at 35.815 levels.
"The 35.80 level seems to be well supported," a dealer said.
The forward premiums eased as exporter sales triggered by Thursday's fall in the rupee's spot rate continued, he said.
The indecision of the United Front government on the long-talked about oil price hike seemed to take away an impending factor that could move the forex market, dealers said.
